byline.contributor: Carl Hulse and Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.

abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump is reportedly considering Sen Jeff Sessions for attorney general or secretary of defense, appointment that would revive past accusations of racial insensitivity; Sessions was denied nomination to federal distinct court judge under Pres Ronald Reagan in 1986 for making racial comments; potential nomination raises possibility that Trump administration will open with racially charged hearings.
lead_paragraph: Accusations of racial comments doomed the 1986 court nomination of Mr. Sessions, an Alabama senator under consideration for attorney general or defense secretary.

headline.main: Specter of Race Shadows Jeff Sessions, Potential Trump Nominee for Cabinet
